reviews.text: Specular view and place to relax. There's have some activities such as ride bicycle, surfing etc.
Nice breeze, cool spot to relax, nice sunset and birds for the birders out there

Marina East Park is a serene and scenic escape located in the heart of Singapore, offering panoramic views of the Marina Bay skyline, the iconic Marina Bay Sands, and the sparkling waters of the Marina Reservoir. It's a peaceful haven that perfectly blends nature with urban beauty.

The park is ideal for outdoor activities, whether it's a casual jog along the walking paths, a relaxing picnic by the water, or simply enjoying the tranquility of the surroundings. The lush greenery and the waterfront views make it a perfect spot for family outings, leisurely strolls, or catching a gorgeous sunset.

A highlight of the park is its innovative design, which includes open spaces, playgrounds, and plenty of shaded areas to enjoy the tropical climate. It's a great place for both relaxation and recreation, offering a quiet retreat from the bustling city life.

Breakwater@Marina East. Great place to unwind and have peace. Enjoy the tranquility, wind, breathtaking view and sound of waves. Sunrise is nice and night scene is amazing. If you are lucky (at night), some resting shore birds may keep you company.

good spot to take picture of famous buildings at the other side. there is a small beach but i think its usually off limits for tourists because its quite new to the port area. its at the end of the Bay East garden
